text: Ilkka Aulis Hanski (14 February 1953 â€“ 10 May 2016) was a Finnish scientist. He worked in the field of ecology at the University of Helsinki. He is known for his research of metapopulation ecology. He was elected a member of the Academia Europaea in 1998. Hanski died of a long-illness on 10 May 2016 at a hospital in Helsinki, aged 63.Akateemikko Ilkka Hanski on kuollut ==Related pages== *List of ecologists from Europe ==References== Category:1953 births Category:2016 deaths Category:Ecologists Category:Finnish academics Category:Members of Academia Europaea
title: Ilkka Hanski
